message: Hello Bob, I believe this product would be incredibly valuable to you, even more so than it is to me. I'm willing to part with it for a price of $1,150,000. This is a fair offer considering its potential worth to you.

I appreciate your willingness to sell, Alice, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $1,150,000. I'm willing to pay $1,100,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering its value to me.

Bob, I understand your position, but I believe my initial offer was already quite reasonable. I'm willing to negotiate, but not to the extent of devaluing the product. How about we meet in the middle at $1,125,000?

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $1,075,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering its value to me.

Bob, it seems like we're hitting a bit of an impasse. I value your time and interest, but I need you to understand the true worth of this product. I'm willing to consider $1,110,000, but that's my absolute bottom line.

I understand your perspective, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $1,050,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering its value to me, and I'm willing to meet you halfway from our previous offers.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but your last offer is simply too low for me to accept. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to see a more serious offer from your side. My final offer is $1,090,000. This is my absolute limit, and I won't go any lower.

I understand that you're firm on your price, Alice, but I'm still not willing to meet you at $1,090,000. I'm willing to pay $1,060,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering its value to me, and I'm willing to make one more serious offer to try to close the deal.
